Text: Re Visupro Data Magnitude and Precision Cc LNotesnsf While I can understand the argument for reducing the amount of storage space required for the STARLite database I want to emphasize that I believe that we should mimic what is already being done in the STAR database Havent each of the variables been datatyped there already Jeff David Miller AM To Kevin NRON cc Jeff nron Subject Re Visupro Data Magnitude and Precision Kevin I think that perhaps it is simpler than all that I want to match the precision of the data storage to the accuracy of the measurements Here is an example of what I am looking for Wind speed In this example there are five digits and two are after the decimal eg This variable could hold a value up to but not including with an accuracy of As I recall wind speed sensors are accurate to one decimal place at best and it is standard practice to go one decimal beyond to prevent rounding error As for how the data is stored I believe that NumberMN is stored internally as M nibbles and puts the decimal before the last N digits Thus the value listed above would require less than bytes to store A standare double precision IEEE floating point requires bytes As to the issue of the number of variables I cant be held responsible for the conscientious manner in which you SCADA people wish to satisfy the data requirements of the company Seriously I hope that many of the sensors are the same type eg temp sensors and the values once determined can be applied to multiple parameters I hope this makes the issue clear David Kevin Cousineau AM To David nron cc Subject Re Visupro Data Magnitude and Precision David First I would like to understand how the data will be stored using only magatitude and precision values Precision is pretty much useless without knowledge of the actual accuracy of the sensor and the converter By magatitude do you mean the number of bits This changes depending upon where the data is collected First the sensors are analog so they do not have a bit weight Second the AD converter used in the Bachmann controll has a limit to its number of bits but when reported through the system may be changed to ASCII where the number of bits grows but not the accuracy Also many of the items on your list do not have a magnatitue or precision such as Turbine ID This is not a sensor or an analog signal although it does have a size in bytes The list is extensive and will require a large amount of work to complete Once again I am not comfortable with data reduction that does not include the accuracy consideration of the sensor the AD converter etc Precision without accuracy is a perfect example This leads to meaningless numbers Consider a sensor with an overall accuracy of This sensor may be connected to a bit converter with a precision and accuracy of Therefore we will have a system that can display the sensors to volt output down to three decimal places when its actual accuracy is only good to one decimal place The remaining digits are useless Because we use a PLC we do not tailer the sensor to the system therefore this type of event happens throughout the Bachmann controller Wind speed readings are a perfect example The anemometer has an overall accuracy of about during high wind speeds and at low wind speeds yet the anemometer counter is capable of accuracies approaching bit or Once again we will have lots of digits that are not usable in anyones calculations Perhaps an explanation of how the reduction will work is in order It would be helpful for you to know the actual accuracy of the systems so that we may determine how many ditigs are usefull and how many are not This would be a better approach to help limit the amount of data As an example wind speed storage to more then one or two decimal places is simply a waist of storage Perhaps an explanation of how the reduction will work is in order Once Garth returns from Europe I will ask that he start on this task Looking forward to your comments Regards KLC

Re Moving data files from Desert Sky Clear SkyIndian Mesa Cc LNotesnsf MarkTerrie How many MB of data are being moved Is the slow file transfer time a new occurrence or has it been persistent John can your see whether there are transfer errors or if the bandwidth just isnt enough Jeff Mark Fisher PM To Terrie nron cc Hollis NRON John NRON Jeff nron Subject Re Moving data files from Desert Sky Clear SkyIndian Mesa Terrie No I dont have any other suggestions nor have I been given any new ones So continue with creating and sending disks until a reasonable method of transfering the files using the network is provided Mark Terrie Smith PM To Mark nron cc Subject Re Moving data files from Desert Sky Clear SkyIndian Mesa Mark Heard anything yet on what I need to do Terrie Mark Fisher PM To John NRON cc Terrie nron Hollis NRON Subject Moving data files from Desert Sky Clear SkyIndian Mesa John Terrie Smith is trying to move data from the site to the transfer directory This is taking an enormous amount of time Almost hours to move the files for folders of data Is there a better method to make the transfer How can we get the data transfered quickly from that site to here Mark Fisher

Re Moving data files from Desert Sky Clear SkyIndian Mesa Cc LNotesnsf MarkTerrie How many MB of data are being moved Is the slow file transfer time a new occurrence or has it been persistent John can your see whether there are transfer errors or if the bandwidth just isnt enough Jeff Mark Fisher PM To Terrie nron cc Hollis NRON John NRON Jeff nron Subject Re Moving data files from Desert Sky Clear SkyIndian Mesa Terrie No I dont have any other suggestions nor have I been given any new ones So continue with creating and sending disks until a reasonable method of transfering the files using the network is provided Mark Terrie Smith PM To Mark nron cc Subject Re Moving data files from Desert Sky Clear SkyIndian Mesa Mark Heard anything yet on what I need to do Terrie Mark Fisher PM To John NRON cc Terrie nron Hollis NRON Subject Moving data files from Desert Sky Clear SkyIndian Mesa John Terrie Smith is trying to move data from the site to the transfer directory This is taking an enormous amount of time Almost hours to move the files for folders of data Is there a better method to make the transfer How can we get the data transfered quickly from that site to here Mark Fisher
